title: The bottleneck determines throughput
text:
Throughput is limited by the slowest link (the bottleneck) along the end-to-end path between sender and receiver. Even if some links are faster, data cannot be transmitted faster than the narrowest point allows.
Use the idea:
$ \text{Throughput}_{\text{end-to-end}} = \min(R_1, R_2, R_3, \ldots) $
